The number of employed Americans every m: revealing a growth in employment from 89.4 million in March 1979 to 135.2 million in March 2013.
The labor force participation rate: which represents the percentage of the U.S. population considered to be "in the labor force," was examined. In March 2013, this rate was 63.3 percent, the lowest since May 1979.
The employment: to-population ratio, another statistic indicating the proportion of the population that is employed, was also found to have fallen to its lowest level since late 1983.
